summary: The Service Dogs Assisting Veterans Act (SAVES Act) authorizes the Secretary of Veterans Affairs to establish a pilot program awarding grants to non-profit organizations to provide service dogs to eligible veterans. The bill defines eligible veterans based on specific conditions (e.g., PTSD, mobility issues) and tasks the Secretary with providing veterinary insurance for service dogs. The program will last five years, with grants up to $2,000,000, and is authorized for $10 million annually for five fiscal years.
